top_comment.text:
I hate homosexuality because I've endured mental & emotional pain because 
of it.
When I was a young, homosexual German boy, I traveled to where every 
homosexual wishes to live: France. South of France is known for its Italian 
influence in architecture & food. I got a job in a small pizzeria where I 
started as a busboy, later becoming a head chef. It was there I met my 
eventual lover, Gastone. He was my assistant chef. In a pizza contest, we 
were voted best chefs in South France and won with our Margherita Pizza. We 
lived a fantastic, exciting lifestyle, full of adventure over the next 
year; the nightlife was especially fantastic, filled with handsome 
Frenchmen we has come to know very well. Nowhere in the world was there a 
more free place for homosexuals than the French nightlife; A place where I 
felt I belonged. Gastone and I were a happy couple. Tragically, things took 
a turn for the worst. We lost the pizza contest the next year, but that was 
just the beginning. I came to work early one morning & was greeted by the 
smell of pizza. Except it wasn't really pizza! It was Gastone in the oven; 
his mutilated body burnt to a crisp, covered in cheese. It was depressing. 
I had lost a lover & after a short time, I returned to my home in Germany. 
I've since reverted to being straight. To this day, I have a phobia of 
pizza & when I smell it, all I can smell is the charred body of Gastone.
Homosexuality is not welcomed in this world. Everyone should do as I did 
and accept that hard reality. It will only cause you pain if you don't... 
just as it did for me.﻿
top_comment.author: sk8guy36

comments.text:
Sorry for you loss! You should try to fight your phobia by starting with 
mini pizzas.

top_comment.text:
Political Shaun:

I missed this, so my apologies for not coming back to it sooner. 
 Basically, the accusation that she forged the notes turned out to be true. 
 And that means the following:

1) She is a lying scumbag.
2) The couple in question were unfairly criticized for behaviors they never 
exhibited.
3) She's a lying scumbag.

Apparently, she lost her job over this, as well she should have.  I also 
completely agree with +The Young Turks, who argue, quite rightly, that this 
false accusation minimizes the impact of actual discrimination against LGBT 
people elsewhere, including those folks who are actually in situations like 
this.  I don't agree, however, with the notion that this particular person 
wanted to play the professional victim, as I think identifying people as 
such also minimizes the impact of actual discrimination and violence 
against LGBT people.  This is an individual who saw an opportunity to 
exploit a cause for reasons I cannot quite explain, and she got caught.  To 
hell with her.

Shame on you, lady.﻿
top_comment.author: Shaun Duke

comments.text:
Yeah, the reason why these things have come up so much lately is because 
we'd been dragged along by certain sectors into a cultural place where we 
were told "if you question in any way the claims of any kind of 'victim' 
then you are a TERRIBLE PERSON of some kind (racist, sexist, homophobe, 
you're part of "rape culture", etc. whatever)".

So naturally, certain sociopaths realized that, and realized they could say 
whatever the fuck they wanted and people would believe them for fear of 
being branded "prejudiced".  And these fake claims of victimization were 
things that they knew would garner them attention.
comments.author: Kasimir Urbanski

comments.text:
+Stuart Robertson It's probably not as surprising as we think.  It's just 
being reported more frequently now.  Either way, these acts should be 
condemned.
comments.author: Shaun Duke

comments.text:
+Kasimir Urbanski "because we have a cause and a narrative we want to push, 
we should try to pretend that NO ONE has ever lied to promote a progressive 
agenda because they were self-absorbed douchebags who were pursuing set 
agenda mostly to get attention for themselves"

My original comment directly refutes this.  Nothing about what I said 
remotely comes close to this idea, so I'm not sure where you're getting it 
from.  The point was making is something else entirely.

This is a narrative about an individual, not a collective.  "Professional 
victim" does not support a narrative about the individual, but rather does 
harm to the collective.  That she is a scumbag who lied is all the more 
relevant when it comes to the real abuses against LGBT people around the 
world.  She should know better.

In other words:  I'm condemning her not just for being a lying piece of 
crap, but for also damaging the cause she supposedly stands for.  Like I 
said:  to hell with her.
comments.author: Shaun Duke

comments.text:
Also, considering that this specific and particular person apparently also 
lied about being a heavy-combat vet with ptsd and HAVING CANCER, I think 
"professional victim" would just about describe her to a tee...
comments.author: Kasimir Urbanski

comments.text:
I don't see how that follows. I can understand how SOME people with bad 
motives could take this case and say "see? This proves all gay people are 
liars! And that no christians have ever been awful to anyone!", sure. But 
it sounds to me like you're saying "because we have a cause and a narrative 
we want to push, we should try to pretend that NO ONE has ever lied to 
promote a progressive agenda because they were self-absorbed douchebags who 
were pursuing set agenda mostly to get attention for themselves".  That's 
almost as bad, especially since I can think of about a half dozen cases of 
that happening this year alone.

And the above is very LITERALLY proof that people DO lie about being 
discriminated against or persecuted, even people from groups that actually 
do face discrimination and persecution.

Now call me crazy and radical (or, more likely, try to shut me down by 
claiming bigotry) but I have this totally INSANE idea that maybe the best 
thing would be if we just focused on what is actually true, regardless of 
when it is convenient or inconvenient for "our side"...
comments.author: Kasimir Urbanski

comments.text:
+Anneke Dubash Correct.  My point wasn't that some people won't play the 
victim for whatever reason.  But focusing on her as though she is a 
"professional" victim only supports a narrative in which victims can be 
discounted on the basis of the assumption that they are liars by default. 
 That's dangerous territory to be in when it comes to things like 
discrimination and sex crimes, as doubt on the part of the victim adds 
support to the perpetrator, thus diverting attention away from the accused.
comments.author: Shaun Duke

comments.text:
I'm not sure how you got that out of +Shaun Duke's comments, +Kasimir

comments.author: Richard Blackmore

comments.text:
+Richard Blackmore
1. Using his Youtube views as a proxy for people's distrust in mainstream 
media and as an indicator of people turning to TYT for truth in reporting 
real news.  Example.. "We've got over 1 billion views on YT because no 
longer trust mainstream media to report the truth.  Whereas the truth is 
more like TYT spams Youtube with thousands of videos, but gets the majority 
of their views from the ones dealing with pop culture or TMZ/National 
Enquirer type stories, many of which contain salacious or misleading 
titles/thumbnails. 
2. "George Bush won the disputed 2004 election because his cousin worked 
for Fox News and called the results first.  All the other news stations 
didn't want to be late, so therefore, they immediately repeated this 
declaration".  
3. "The USA has the lowest corporate tax rate among OECD countries."
4. His self serving and biased account of how he "quit" MSNBC, because his 
bosses wanted to silence him.
5. "Mainstream media calls everything right down the middle.  GOP says 
this, Dems say this." 
6. Even his signature calling about getting money out of politics is laced 
with half truths.  Most people, including myself agree that money should 
not corrupt politics, so I agree with the intent.  But to back his 
position, he quotes "facts" about "x" percentage of the time, the candidate 
with the highest fundraising wins the election.  He says this and all 
impressionable TYT viewers thinks he's got a point.  But Cenk never raises 
the well known principle that money doesn't just influence the winner, but 
that it follows the winner.  Meaning, if a candidate is going to win, even 
by a landslide, a donor will still donate money to that candiate for 
possibly future access.  That doesn't mean the money helps determine the 
winner.  Sure, the money might still be intended for less than noble 
reasons in the future, but the point is it doesn't determine the winner.  
The fact Cenk never points that out, or that TYT vierwers can never figure 
this out is infuriating, although not unexpected.
comments.author: hofifut

comments.text: Would you name 3 half-truths?

comments.text:
I figured it was a hoax when the news originally broke with local media. I 
said even then, that all that has to happen, is for the family to challenge 
the transaction amount with their card issuer. As soon as they dispute, the 
bank will ask the restaurant for verification with a copy of the signed 
receipt. If they can't produce it, the restaurant is screwed (Given the 
employee has to tell the register before End of Shift what the final amount 
to bill the card is, and businesses have to hold onto their card 
transaction records both for accounting purposes as well as for 
verification requests by banks). If they do produce it, the waitress is 
screwed for either lying to the computer about the final amount, or the 
bigoted reprint.

top_comment.text:
@2:52 So because we want Ana to sit on our faces, she wants a donation or 
two?
Does anyone else see the obvious joke here ... or do I REALLY have to say 
it?﻿
top_comment.author: UniversalPotentate

comments.text: +Xeranx She walked into it and slipped on it! X'D
comments.author: UniversalPotentate

comments.text:
I was focused on the absurdity of her comment about facez-sitting and 
completely missed what she walked into. Thanks for pointing it out.
comments.author: Xeranx

top_comment.text:
The girl just saw a possibility in making quick bucks by exploiting 
cultural factors. Basic, many people do this all the time.﻿

comments.author: ILL MICROPHONE

comments.text:

clear my mind.
comments.author: Arto Pekkanen

comments.text: +Arto Pekkanen lol why are you talking to yourself?
comments.author: ILL MICROPHONE

comments.text:
I'd just say that people in general are sick in the head. Be it straight or 
queer, it matters not. We as humans succumb into individualism induced 
existential emptiness and find joy in exploiting others.
comments.author: Arto Pekkanen

comments.text: Or maybe I am just too jaded?
comments.author: Arto Pekkanen

top_comment.text:
I started a new job today after being out of work for a while. One of the 
first things out of my new bosses mouth was "maybe it is genetics, this is 
why different races shouldn't breed" in reference to my hair loss [I'm a 
woman]. Do I want money? Yes. Do I want money from random strangers who 
feel sorry for me? No. Due to the former I am going to continue to work for 
this racist bitch until I find a new job which is hopefully going to be as 
fast as possible. 

People who make up crap like this to get attention and money make me so mad 
when there are so many people out there who live and put up with REAL shit 
like this every day and don't cause a fuss about it.  Because in the end, 
the opinions of vile, racist, homophobic bigots mean nothing other than 
they live sad pathetic little lives.﻿
top_comment.author: fiveohfivethree

comments.text:
I've been out of work too long to let an ignorant bitch like that get to 
me. Plus, she obviously doesn't like people of mixed race so quitting would 
be doing her a favour ;)
comments.author: fiveohfivethree

comments.text: Wow, Such tale, much tolerate, so racist. wow
